DataElement.preferredDefinition: Cancer stage as captured by the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm that occurs during childhood. Representative examples include acute leukemias, malignant brain neoplasms, and sarcomas.:A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm that occurs during childhood. Representative examples include acute leukemias, malignant brain neoplasms, and sarcomas.

Concepts.longName: Childhood Malignant Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that occurs during childhood. Representative examples include acute leukemias, malignant brain neoplasms, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)

Concepts.longName: Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines
Concepts.definition: A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 4/3/23 Created per Patrick Dunn for CCDI SN 2165 entry. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)_The extent of a cancer in the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Initial CNS and/or bone marrow involvement. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Initial CNS and/or bone marrow involvement. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage L1 Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Localized tumor that does not involve any vital structures as defined by the list of IDRFs (i.e., there are no IDRFs) and the tumor must be confined within one body compartment, neck, chest, abdomen, or pelvis. An intraspinal tumor extension that does not fulfill the criteria for an IDRF is consistent with stage L1. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage L1 Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Localized tumor that does not involve any vital structures as defined by the list of IDRFs (i.e., there are no IDRFs) and the tumor must be confined within one body compartment, neck, chest, abdomen, or pelvis. An intraspinal tumor extension that does not fulfill the criteria for an IDRF is consistent with stage L1. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage L2 Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Locoregional tumor with one or more IDRFs. The tumor may be ipsilateral contiguous within body compartments (i.e., a left-sided abdominal tumor with left-sided lung, bone or pleura involvement should be considered stage L2). However, a clearly left-sided abdominal tumor with right-sided lung, bone or pleura (or vice-versa) involvement is defined as metastatic disease. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage L2 Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Locoregional tumor with one or more IDRFs. The tumor may be ipsilateral contiguous within body compartments (i.e., a left-sided abdominal tumor with left-sided lung, bone or pleura involvement should be considered stage L2). However, a clearly left-sided abdominal tumor with right-sided lung, bone or pleura (or vice-versa) involvement is defined as metastatic disease. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage M Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distant metastatic disease (i.e., not contiguous with the primary tumor) except as defined for stage MS. Nonregional (distant) lymph node involvement is metastatic disease. However, an upper abdominal tumor with enlarged lower mediastinal nodes or a pelvic tumor with inguinal lymph node involvement is considered locoregional disease. Ascites and/or a pleural effusion, even with malignant cells, do not constitute metastatic disease unless they are remote from the body compartment of the primary tumor. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage M Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Distant metastatic disease (i.e., not contiguous with the primary tumor) except as defined for stage MS. Nonregional (distant) lymph node involvement is metastatic disease. However, an upper abdominal tumor with enlarged lower mediastinal nodes or a pelvic tumor with inguinal lymph node involvement is considered locoregional disease. Ascites and/or a pleural effusion, even with malignant cells, do not constitute metastatic disease unless they are remote from the body compartment of the primary tumor. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage I

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children’s Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor is limited to the kidney and completely excised. Renal capsule intact, not penetrated by tumor. No tumor invasion of veins or lymphatics of renal sinus. No nodal or hematogenous metastases. No prior biopsy. Negative margins. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children's Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Tumor is limited to the kidney and completely excised. Renal capsule intact, not penetrated by tumor. No tumor invasion of veins or lymphatics of renal sinus. No nodal or hematogenous metastases. No prior biopsy. Negative margins. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage II

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children’s Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor extends beyond kidney but completely resected. Tumor penetrates renal capsule. Tumor in lymphatics or veins of renal sinus. Tumor in renal vein with margin not involved. No nodal or hematogenous metastases. Negative margins. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children's Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Tumor extends beyond kidney but completely resected. Tumor penetrates renal capsule. Tumor in lymphatics or veins of renal sinus. Tumor in renal vein with margin not involved. No nodal or hematogenous metastases. Negative margins. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage III

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children’s Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Residual tumor or nonhematogenous metastases confined to abdomen. Involved abdominal nodes. Peritoneal contamination or tumor implant. Tumor spillage of any degree occurring before or during surgery. Gross residual tumor in abdomen. Biopsy of tumor (including fine-needle aspiration) prior to removal of kidney. Resection margins involved by tumor. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children's Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Residual tumor or nonhematogenous metastases confined to abdomen. Involved abdominal nodes. Peritoneal contamination or tumor implant. Tumor spillage of any degree occurring before or during surgery. Gross residual tumor in abdomen. Biopsy of tumor (including fine-needle aspiration) prior to removal of kidney. Resection margins involved by tumor. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage IV

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children’s Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematogenous metastases or spread beyond abdomen at diagnosis. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, Children's Oncology Group (COG) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Hematogenous metastases or spread beyond abdomen at diagnosis. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage y-I

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage y-I Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor limited to kidney and completely resected. Renal capsule may be infiltrated by tumor, but tumor does not reach the outer surface. Tumor may protrude or bulge into the pelvic system or ureter but does not infiltrate. Vessel of renal sinus not involved. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage y-I Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Tumor limited to kidney and completely resected. Renal capsule may be infiltrated by tumor, but tumor does not reach the outer surface. Tumor may protrude or bulge into the pelvic system or ureter but does not infiltrate. Vessel of renal sinus not involved. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage MS Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Metastatic disease confined to skin, liver, and/or bone marrow, in a patient less than 18 months (547 days). MIBG scintigraphy must be negative in bone and bone marrow. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage MS Childhood Neuroblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Metastatic disease confined to skin, liver, and/or bone marrow, in a patient less than 18 months (547 days). MIBG scintigraphy must be negative in bone and bone marrow. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 1 Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No clinical signs of CNS involvement and no blasts in CSF. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 1 Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: No clinical signs of CNS involvement and no blasts in CSF. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 2 Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No clinical signs of CNS involvement and blasts in CSF and either: WBC < 5/μL CSF or WBC > or = 5/uL CSF and RBC > or = 10/uL CSF and WBC/RBC in CSF < or = 2x WBC/RBC in blood. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 2 Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: No clinical signs of CNS involvement and blasts in CSF and either: WBC < 5/μL CSF or WBC > or = 5/uL CSF and RBC > or = 10/uL CSF and WBC/RBC in CSF < or = 2x WBC/RBC in blood. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 3 Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Clinical signs of CNS involvement or blasts in CSF and WBC > or = 5/uL CSF and either: RBC < 10/uL CSF or RBC > or = 10/uL CSF and WBC/RBC in CSF > 2x WBC/RBC in blood. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia CNS 3 Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Clinical signs of CNS involvement or blasts in CSF and WBC > or = 5/uL CSF and either: RBC < 10/uL CSF or RBC > or = 10/uL CSF and WBC/RBC in CSF > 2x WBC/RBC in blood. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involvement of a single lymph node region or involvement of a single extra-lymphatic organ or site, without lymph node involvement. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2).  (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Involvement of a single lymph node region or involvement of a single extra-lymphatic organ or site, without lymph node involvement. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2).  (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involvement of lymph node regions on both sides (above and below) of the diaphragm. This may be accompanied by extra-lymphatic extension in association with adjacent lymph node involvement (i.e., local extension from a lymph node area into a nearby organ) and/or involvement of spleen. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Involvement of lymph node regions on both sides (above and below) of the diaphragm. This may be accompanied by extra-lymphatic extension in association with adjacent lymph node involvement (i.e., local extension from a lymph node area into a nearby organ) and/or involvement of spleen. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diffuse or disseminated (multifocal) involvement of one or more extra-lymphatic organs with or without associated lymph node involvement or isolated (non-contiguous) extra-lymphatic organ involvement in the absence of adjacent regional lymph node involvement, but in conjunction with disease in distant site(s) or any involvement of liver, bone marrow, lungs (except by direct extension from another site) or CSF. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Diffuse or disseminated (multifocal) involvement of one or more extra-lymphatic organs with or without associated lymph node involvement or isolated (non-contiguous) extra-lymphatic organ involvement in the absence of adjacent regional lymph node involvement, but in conjunction with disease in distant site(s) or any involvement of liver, bone marrow, lungs (except by direct extension from another site) or CSF. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involvement of a single tumor mass or nodal area, excluding the abdomen and mediastinum. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Involvement of a single tumor mass or nodal area, excluding the abdomen and mediastinum. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A single tumor (extranodal) with regional node involvement or two or more nodal areas on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or two or more single (extranodal) tumors, with or without regional node involvement, on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or a completely resected primary gastrointestinal tract tumor with or without involvement of associated mesenteric nodes only. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: A single tumor (extranodal) with regional node involvement or two or more nodal areas on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or two or more single (extranodal) tumors, with or without regional node involvement, on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or a completely resected primary gastrointestinal tract tumor with or without involvement of associated mesenteric nodes only. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumors (extranodal) or nodal areas on both sides (above and below) of the diaphragm or any primary intrathoracic tumors (mediastinal, hilar, pulmonary, pleural, or thymic) or extensive (unresectable) primary intra-abdominal disease or any paraspinal or epidural tumors regardless of other tumor sites. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Childhood Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Tumors (extranodal) or nodal areas on both sides (above and below) of the diaphragm or any primary intrathoracic tumors (mediastinal, hilar, pulmonary, pleural, or thymic) or extensive (unresectable) primary intra-abdominal disease or any paraspinal or epidural tumors regardless of other tumor sites. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or localized involvement of a single extra-lymphatic organ or site in association with regional lymph node involvement (i.e., local extension from a lymph node area into a nearby organ), with or without involvement of other contiguous lymph node regions on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Childhood Hodgkin Lymphoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm or localized involvement of a single extra-lymphatic organ or site in association with regional lymph node involvement (i.e., local extension from a lymph node area into a nearby organ), with or without involvement of other contiguous lymph node regions on the same side (either above or below) of the diaphragm. This definition applies to both tiers (tier 1 and 2). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage y-II

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage y-II Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tumor extends beyond kidney but completely resected. Tumor penetrates renal capsule into perirenal fat. Tumor infiltrates the renal sinus and/or invades blood and lymphatic vessels outside renal parenchyma but is completely resected. Tumor infiltrates adjacent organs or vena cava but is completely resected. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage y-II Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Tumor extends beyond kidney but completely resected. Tumor penetrates renal capsule into perirenal fat. Tumor infiltrates the renal sinus and/or invades blood and lymphatic vessels outside renal parenchyma but is completely resected. Tumor infiltrates adjacent organs or vena cava but is completely resected. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage y-III

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage y-III Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Incomplete excision of the tumor (gross or microscopic extension beyond the resection margins). Involved abdominal lymph nodes, including necrotic tumor or chemotherapy-induced changes. Tumor rupture before or intraoperatively. Tumor has penetrated the peritoneal surface. Tumor thrombi present at resection margins. Surgical biopsy prior to resection (does not include needle biopsy). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage y-III Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Incomplete excision of the tumor (gross or microscopic extension beyond the resection margins). Involved abdominal lymph nodes, including necrotic tumor or chemotherapy-induced changes. Tumor rupture before or intraoperatively. Tumor has penetrated the peritoneal surface. Tumor thrombi present at resection margins. Surgical biopsy prior to resection (does not include needle biopsy). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Renal tumor (excluding renal cell carcinomas) Stage IV

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hematogenous metastases or spread beyond abdomen at diagnosis. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Childhood Malignant Kidney Neoplasm Excluding Renal Cell Carcinoma by Toronto Guidelines v2, International Society of Pediatric Oncology (SIOP) Protocol
Concepts.definition: Hematogenous metastases or spread beyond abdomen at diagnosis. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unfavorable site and T1a, T2a, N0, M0. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Unfavorable site and T1a, T2a, N0, M0. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unfavorable site and (T1a, T2a, N1, M0); (T1b, T2b, Any N, M0). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Unfavorable site and (T1a, T2a, N1, M0); (T1b, T2b, Any N, M0). (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any site and any T, any N, M1. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Childhood Rhabdomyosarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2
Concepts.definition: Any site and any T, any N, M1. (Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines - Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.)

PermissibleValues.value: Non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma Stage I

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Childhood Non-Rhabdomyosarcoma Soft Tissue Sarcoma by Toronto Guidelines v2

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage 0 Childhood Retinoblastoma by Toronto Guidelines v2

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines Neoplasm Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)_The extent of a cancer in the body.

Concepts.longName: Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines
Concepts.definition: A malignancy-specific staging system suitable for use by population registries for 16 of the most common childhood malignancies: acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, neuroblastoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdomyosarcoma, non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcoma, osteosarcoma, Ewing sarcoma, retinoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, testicular and ovarian germ cell tumors, medulloblastoma, and ependymoma. The Guidelines include a two-tiered approach that provides less detailed criteria for registries with limited resources and/or limited data access (Tier 1) and more detailed criteria for better-resourced registries (Tier 2). Tier 2 stage categories may be collapsed to Tier 1 categories to preserve comparability across registries. (http://www.iacr.com.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=153&Itemid=657)

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
